bug.author: Nintorac
bug.summary: Simultaneously started runs are too similarly coloured
bug.description:
wandb, version 0.9.1 Python 3.6.10 :: Anaconda, Inc. Linux <denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
Starting multiple runs simultaneously results in very similar colours in the web front end <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24326299/85290412-4d3efd80-b4dc-11ea-9266-f3f8d79b1638.png></denchmark-link>
The bottom 4 runs in the screen capture were started simultaneously <denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
Using ray.tune to launch a grid search

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.86. Please mark this comment with 👍 or 👎 to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Nintorac>@Nintorac</denchmark-link> this is currently by design. You can change the colors in the UI by clicking on the circles. We'll sync internally about the best thing to do in this case.

Just a bit of a pain to manually change multiples of runs but must be done otherwise the runs cannot be visually distinguished. Might make more sense to try and base colours on hyper params but might be tricky to implement.
